csharp_simple:
1using System;
2using System.Collections.Generic;
3​
4namespace TechnicalIndicators
5{
6 /// <summary>
7 /// Fractal Dimension Index (FDI)
8 /// </summary>
9 /// <remarks>
10 /// Measures the "fractal dimension" of the price series to determine market volatility/trendiness.
11 /// <list type="bullet">
12 /// <item><description>Values near 1.5 indicate random walk.</description></item>
13 /// <item><description>Values approaching 1.0 indicate strong trend.</description></item>
14 /// <item><description>Values approaching 2.0 indicate high volatility/noise.</description></item>
15 /// </list>
16 /// </remarks>
17 public class FractalDimensionIndex
18 {
19 public int Period { get; }
20 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
21​
22 public FractalDimensionIndex(int period = 30)
23 {
24 if (period <= 1) throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(period));
25 Period = period;
26 }
27​
28 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
29 {
30 Values.Clear();
31 var c = new List<CandleData>(candles);
32 if (c.Count == 0) return;
33​
34 for (int i = 0; i < c.Count; i++)
35 {
36 if (i < Period - 1) { Values.Add(null); continue; }
37​
38 double sumDiff = 0;
39 double highestHigh = double.MinValue;
40 double lowestLow = double.MaxValue;
41​
42 // Step 1: Calculate Range and Path Length over Period
43 for (int j = 0; j < Period; j++)
44 {
45 double high = (double)c[i - j].High;
46 double low = (double)c[i - j].Low;
47 if (high > highestHigh) highestHigh = high;
48 if (low < lowestLow) lowestLow = low;
49​
50 if (j < Period - 1)
51 {
52 double currentClose = (double)c[i - j].Close;
53 double prevClose = (double)c[i - j - 1].Close;
54 sumDiff += Math.Abs(currentClose - prevClose);
55 }
56 }
57​
58 double priceRange = highestHigh - lowestLow;
59 if (priceRange == 0 || sumDiff == 0)
60 {
61 Values.Add(1.5m); // Default for flat line
62 continue;
63 }
64​
65 double n = Period - 1;
66
67 // Step 2: FDI Formula
68 // FDI = 1 + [ log(Length / Range) + log(n) ] / log(2*n)
69 double fdi = 1 + (Math.Log(sumDiff / priceRange) + Math.Log(n)) / Math.Log(2 * n);
70
71 // Clamp results
72 fdi = Math.Max(1, Math.Min(2, fdi));
73​
74 Values.Add((decimal)fdi);
75 }
76 }
77​
78 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period = 30)
79 {
80 var fdi = new FractalDimensionIndex(period);
81 fdi.Calculate(candles);
82 return fdi.Values;
83 }
84 }
85}
csharp_detailed:
1// =============================================================================
2// Logic Breakdown (FractalDimensionIndex)
3// =============================================================================
4//
5// This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6// Fractal Dimension Index (FDI).
7// We explain *why* code is written this way and *how* data transforms
8// line-by-line, targeting programming beginners.
9//
10// [Core Concepts]
11//
12// 1. Order vs. Chaos
13// [Goal] Determine if the market is trending (Order) or range-bound (Chaos).
14// [How] Using fractal geometry math tailored for time-series data.
15//
16// 2. The Scale
17// [Range] 1.0 to 2.0.
18// - 1.0 (Line): A straight line. (Strong Trend).
19// - 1.5 (Random): Brownian motion (Random Walk).
20// - 2.0 (Plane): Fills the 2D plane. (Extreme Choppiness/Range).
21// [Threshold] Often, values below 1.5 indicate a trend is forming.
22//
23// 3. The Math (Simplified)
24// It compares "Process Path Length" (total distance traveled) vs.
25// "Euclidean Distance" (net distance traveled).
26// - If Total matches Net, it's a straight line (Trend).
27// - If Total is huge but Net is small, it's zigzagging wildly (Range).
28//
29// [Visual Plan]
30// SumDiff: Sum of |Close[i] - Close[i-1]| (Path Length)
31// Range: HighestHigh - LowestLow (Box Height)
32// FDI: Logarithmic ratio of the two.
33//
34// =============================================================================
35​
36using System;
37using System.Collections.Generic;
38​
39namespace TechnicalIndicators
40{
41 // =============================================================================
42 // Logic Explanation: OHLCV Data Container
43 // =============================================================================
44 public readonly record struct CandleData(DateTime Timestamp, decimal Open, decimal High, decimal Low, decimal Close, long Volume);
45​
46 // =============================================================================
47 // Logic Explanation: Fractal Dimension Index Class
48 // =============================================================================
49 public class FractalDimensionIndex
50 {
51 // -------------------------------------------------------------
52 // Logic Explanation: Configuration
53 //
54 // [Period] Standard is often 30 or larger to get a good sample size.
55 // -------------------------------------------------------------
56 public int Period { get; }
57 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
58​
59 // =============================================================================
60 // Logic Explanation: Constructor
61 // =============================================================================
62 public FractalDimensionIndex(int period = 30)
63 {
64 if (period <= 1)
65 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(period));
66 Period = period;
67 }
68​
69 // =============================================================================
70 // Logic Explanation: Main Calculation Method
71 // =============================================================================
72 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
73 {
74 // -------------------------------------------------------------
75 // Step 1: Cleanup & Setup
76 // -------------------------------------------------------------
77 Values.Clear();
78 var c = new List<CandleData>(candles);
79 if (c.Count == 0) return;
80​
81 // -------------------------------------------------------------
82 // Step 2: Main Loop
83 // -------------------------------------------------------------
84 for (int i = 0; i < c.Count; i++)
85 {
86 // -------------------------------------------------------------
87 // Phase A: Insufficient Data
88 // -------------------------------------------------------------
89 if (i < Period - 1)
90 {
91 Values.Add(null);
92 continue;
93 }
94​
95 // -------------------------------------------------------------
96 // Phase B: Calculate Components over 'Period'
97 //
98 // [SumDiff] The total vertical distance traveled (sum of absolute changes).
99 // [PriceRange] The vertical height of the bounding box (High - Low).
100 // -------------------------------------------------------------
101 double sumDiff = 0;
102 double highestHigh = double.MinValue;
103 double lowestLow = double.MaxValue;
104​
105 // Loop back 'Period' bars
106 for (int j = 0; j < Period; j++)
107 {
108 // Access index: i - j
109 int currIdx = i - j;
110
111 double high = (double)c[currIdx].High;
112 double low = (double)c[currIdx].Low;
113
114 if (high > highestHigh) highestHigh = high;
115 if (low < lowestLow) lowestLow = low;
116​
117 // Calculate difference from previous close (if not at end of window)
118 // Note: We need 'Period - 1' diffs.
119 if (j < Period - 1)
120 {
121 double currentClose = (double)c[currIdx].Close;
122 double prevClose = (double)c[currIdx - 1].Close;
123 sumDiff += Math.Abs(currentClose - prevClose);
124 }
125 }
126​
127 // -------------------------------------------------------------
128 // Phase C: Compute FDI
129 //
130 // [Math]
131 // N = Period - 1 (Number of segments)
132 // FDI = 1 + (Log(SumDiff + PriceRange) - Log(PriceRange) ) / Log(2*N) ???
133 // Wait, standard formula is:
134 // FDI = 1 + ( Log(PathLength / Range) + Log(2)?? ) ...
135 //
136 // Let's stick to the implementation's formula:
137 // FDI = 1 + ( Log(sumDiff / priceRange) + Log(n) ) / Log(2 * n)
138 // -------------------------------------------------------------
139 double priceRange = highestHigh - lowestLow;
140
141 // Edge Case: Flat line or bad data
142 if (priceRange <= 0 || sumDiff <= 0)
143 {
144 Values.Add(1.5m); // Return Neutral/Random
145 continue;
146 }
147​
148 double n = Period - 1;
149
150 // 1. Ratio of actual travel vs direct travel
151 // 2. Adjust for sample size (n)
152 double numerator = Math.Log(sumDiff / priceRange) + Math.Log(n);
153 double denominator = Math.Log(2 * n);
154
155 double fdi = 1 + (numerator / denominator);
156​
157 // -------------------------------------------------------------
158 // Phase D: Clamp & Store
159 //
160 // [Why] Mathematically FDI is between 1 and 2.
161 // Floating point errors might push it slightly outside.
162 // -------------------------------------------------------------
163 fdi = Math.Max(1.0, Math.Min(2.0, fdi));
164
165 Values.Add((decimal)fdi);
166 }
167 }
168​
169 // =============================================================================
170 // Logic Explanation: Static Convenience Wrapper
171 // =============================================================================
172 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period = 30)
173 {
174 var fdi = new FractalDimensionIndex(period);
175 fdi.Calculate(candles);
176 return fdi.Values;
177 }
178 }
179}
python_simple:
1import math
2​
3class FractalDimensionIndex:
4 """
5 Fractal Dimension Index (FDI)
6 Measures market 'jaggedness'.
7 1.0 = Straight line.
8 1.5 = Random walk.
9 2.0 = Plane filling.
10 """
11 def __init__(self, period=30):
12 self.period = period
13 self.values = []
14​
15 def calculate(self, candles):
16 self.values.clear()
17 if len(candles) == 0: return
18​
19 for i in range(len(candles)):
20 if i < self.period - 1:
21 self.values.append(None)
22 continue
23​
24 sum_diff = 0.0
25 highest = float('-inf')
26 lowest = float('inf')
27
28 # Lookback window
29 for j in range(self.period):
30 # Min/Max
31 h = candles[i-j]['high']
32 l = candles[i-j]['low']
33 if h > highest: highest = h
34 if l < lowest: lowest = l
35
36 # Path Length
37 if j < self.period - 1:
38 curr_c = candles[i-j]['close']
39 prev_c = candles[i-j-1]['close']
40 sum_diff += abs(curr_c - prev_c)
41
42 price_range = highest - lowest
43 if price_range == 0 or sum_diff == 0:
44 self.values.append(1.5)
45 continue
46
47 n = self.period - 1
48 # FDI = 1 + [ log(Length / Range) + log(n) ] / log(2*n)
49 fdi = 1 + (math.log(sum_diff / price_range) + math.log(n)) / math.log(2 * n)
50
51 # Constraint: [1, 2]
52 fdi = max(1.0, min(2.0, fdi))
53
54 self.values.append(fdi)
55​
56def calculate(candles, period=30):
57 fdi = FractalDimensionIndex(period)
58 fdi.calculate(candles)
59 return fdi.values
python_detailed:
1# =============================================================================
2# Logic Breakdown (Fractal Dimension Index)
3# =============================================================================
4#
5# This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6# Fractal Dimension Index (FDI). We explain *why* code is written this way
7# and *how* data transforms line-by-line, targeting programming beginners.
8#
9# [Core Concepts]
10# 1. Fractal Geometry
11# Financial markets are not purely random nor purely deterministic.
12# They are "Fractals" (rough shapes).
13# - Dimension 1.0: A perfectly straight line (Strong Trend).
14# - Dimension 2.0: A plane-filling zag-zag (Pure Noise).
15# - Market Reality: Usually oscillates between 1.3 and 1.6.
16#
17# 2. The Critical Threshold (1.5)
18# - FDI < 1.5: The market is "Trending" (Persistent).
19# (A move up is likely followed by a move up).
20# - FDI > 1.5: The market is "Mean Reverting" (Anti-Persistent).
21# (A move up is likely followed by a move down).
22#
23# 3. Calculation Method
24# We measure the "Roughness" of the price curve over N bars.
25# Formula: Compare the "Length of the line" vs the "Size of the box" it fits in.
26#
27# =============================================================================
28​
29import math
30​
31# -------------------------------------------------------------
32# Type-Level Explanation: FractalDimensionIndex (class)
33#
34# [Why] Complex sliding window implementation.
35# [What] Chaos Theory Indicator based on Hurst Exponent concepts.
36# [How] Calculates the "roughness" of the price series by comparing the total path length (sum of changes) to the vertical range (High-Low) over a lookback window, using logarithmic scaling.
37# [Who] Algorithmic Traders, Quants.
38# [Where] Heap.
39# -------------------------------------------------------------
40class FractalDimensionIndex:
41​
42 # -------------------------------------------------------------
43 # Logic Explanation: Indicator Configuration (Public Properties)
44 #
45 # [Why]
46 # FDI requires a significant sample size to be statistically meaningful.
47 # A period of 30 or higher is recommended.
48 # -------------------------------------------------------------
49​
50 # -------------------------------------------------------------
51 # Constructor: __init__
52 #
53 # [Input]
54 # - period: int (Sample size, default 30)
55 #
56 # [Why]
57 # Configure the window size.
58 # -------------------------------------------------------------
59 def __init__(self, period=30):
60
61 # -------------------------------------------------------------
62 # Logic Step 1: Validation
63 # [Why] Need at least 2 points to draw a line segment.
64 # Generally, < 30 is too noisy for Fractals.
65 # -------------------------------------------------------------
66 if period <= 1:
67 raise ValueError(f"Period must be greater than 1. Received: {period}")
68​
69 self.period = period
70
71 # -------------------------------------------------------------
72 # Variable Definition: Output
73 # [Role] Stores the FDI values (1.0 to 2.0).
74 # -------------------------------------------------------------
75 self.values = []
76​
77​
78 # =============================================================================
79 # IPO: calculate
80 # =============================================================================
81 #
82 # [Input]
83 # - candles: list[dict] (Must have 'high', 'low', 'close')
84 #
85 # [Process]
86 # 1. Slide a window of size 'Period' across the data.
87 # 2. Within each window:
88 # a. Calculate "Path Length" (Sum of absolute price changes).
89 # b. Calculate "Box Height" (Highest High - Lowest Low).
90 # 3. Apply Logarithmic Formula to derive Dimension.
91 #
92 # [Output]
93 # - None (populates self.values)
94 # =============================================================================
95 def calculate(self, candles):
96
97 # -------------------------------------------------------------
98 # Logic Step 1: Reset
99 # -------------------------------------------------------------
100 self.values.clear()
101
102 if len(candles) == 0:
103 return
104​
105 # -------------------------------------------------------------
106 # Logic Step 2: Main Loop (Sliding Window)
107 #
108 # [Why]
109 # Calculate FDI for every bar where we have enough data.
110 # -------------------------------------------------------------
111 for i in range(len(candles)):
112
113 # -------------------------------------------------------------
114 # Logic Step 2.1: Insufficient Data
115 #
116 # [Decision]
117 # Do we have 'period' bars ending at i?
118 #
119 # [True Branch: Wait]
120 # - Pad with None.
121 # -------------------------------------------------------------
122 if i < self.period - 1:
123 self.values.append(None)
124 continue
125​
126 # -------------------------------------------------------------
127 # Logic Step 2.2: Window Analysis (Inner Loop)
128 #
129 # [Why]
130 # We need to compute two metrics over the last N bars:
131 # 1. Total Path Length (The "jagged" distance walked).
132 # 2. Box Height (The vertical range covered).
133 #
134 # [Visual]
135 # Path: A->B->C->D (Sum of distances)
136 # Box: Max(A,B,C,D) - Min(A,B,C,D)
137 # -------------------------------------------------------------
138 path_length = 0.0
139 highest_high = float('-inf')
140 lowest_low = float('inf')
141
142 # Iterate backwards 'period' times
143 # Range: [i - period + 1] to [i]
144 for j in range(self.period):
145 current_idx = i - j
146
147 # Logic Step 2.2a: Update Box Limits
148 h = candles[current_idx]['high']
149 l = candles[current_idx]['low']
150
151 if h > highest_high:
152 highest_high = h
153 if l < lowest_low:
154 lowest_low = l
155
156 # Logic Step 2.2b: Accumulate Path Segment
157 # We need distance between current and previous.
158 # Skip the oldest bar in window (j=period-1) because proper "previous"
159 # might be outside logic or just handled differently.
160 # Actually, we accumulate (N-1) segments for N points.
161 if j < self.period - 1:
162 close_curr = candles[current_idx]['close']
163 close_prev = candles[current_idx - 1]['close']
164
165 # Euclidean distance on 1D Price axis basically.
166 # (Ignoring Time axis scaling for simplicity in this variation)
167 path_length += abs(close_curr - close_prev)
168​
169 # -------------------------------------------------------------
170 # Logic Step 2.3: Compute Metrics
171 #
172 # [What]
173 # - Price Range: The vertical size of the bounding box.
174 # - Path Length: The total length of the price zag-zags.
175 # -------------------------------------------------------------
176 box_height = highest_high - lowest_low
177
178 # -------------------------------------------------------------
179 # Logic Step 2.4: Divide by Zero Guard
180 #
181 # [Decision]
182 # Is price flat? (Box Height = 0)
183 # Or is Path Length 0?
184 #
185 # [True Branch: Default]
186 # - Assume Neutral/Random (1.5).
187 # -------------------------------------------------------------
188 if box_height == 0 or path_length == 0:
189 self.values.append(1.5)
190 continue
191​
192 # -------------------------------------------------------------
193 # Logic Step 2.5: Logarithmic Transformation
194 #
195 # [Why]
196 # Fractal Dimension is a log-log relationship.
197 # D = Log(Path) / Log(Scale) roughly.
198 #
199 # [Formula]
200 # N = period - 1 (Number of segments)
201 # FDI = 1 + [ log(Path / BoxHeight) + log(2) ] / log(2 * N)
202 # (Note: specific constant '2' comes from specific FDI derivation)
203 # -------------------------------------------------------------
204 n_segments = self.period - 1
205
206 # Numerator: Log of (Normalized Path Length)
207 term1 = math.log(path_length / box_height)
208 term2 = math.log(2) # Constant
209
210 numerator = term1 + term2
211 denominator = math.log(2 * n_segments)
212
213 fdi = 1 + (numerator / denominator)
214
215 # -------------------------------------------------------------
216 # Logic Step 2.6: Clamp Result
217 #
218 # [Why]
219 # Theoretically bounded [1, 2].
220 # 1 = Straight Line.
221 # 2 = Plane Filling Noise.
222 # -------------------------------------------------------------
223 fdi = max(1.0, min(2.0, fdi))
224
225 self.values.append(fdi)
226​
227​
228# =============================================================================
229# Functional Wrapper (Procedural Interface)
230# =============================================================================
231def calculate(candles, period=30):
232 """
233 Computes Fractal Dimension Index.
234 """
235 # 1. Instantiation
236 instance = FractalDimensionIndex(period)
237
238 # 2. Execution
239 instance.calculate(candles)
240
241 # 3. Extraction
242 return instance.values
